ARTICLE.TITLE: Documentation Overview
ARTICLE.para: The MusicKit documentation is organized as follows. The original version of this documentation was written by Douglas Fulton, based on notes by David A. Jaffe and Julius Smith, except where noted. Keep in mind that some of the documentation is not quite up to date. Consult the Release Notes for the latest information. The header file comments are sometimes more reliable than the documentation. The top documentation directory is
The various subdirectories are summarized below:

LISTITEM.para: Info on other software available on the Net.
How to use MIDI on NeXT and Intel hardware.
Mathematica document illustrating and explaining the way that asymptotic envelopes used by the MusicKit work. By Julius Smith.
Benchmarks explaining how many of various SynthPatches can be run in real time.

VARLISTENTRY.TERM: Classes, Functions, Synthpatches, and UnitGenerators Subdirectories

LISTITEM.para: These directories contain the "Music Reference" portion of the "Sound, Music and DSP Concepts Manual." This is generally more up to date than the Concepts documentation. Still, note that portions of this documentation are out of date. For release 4.0, the directories have been reorganized for compatibility with HeaderViewer. You can drag the directories MusicKit, SynthPatches, and UnitGenerators into HeaderViewer's documentation list to correspond with the headerfile directories musickit, synthpatches, and unitgenerators in /LocalDeveloper/Headers/.
Class descriptions of the core MusicKit classes, such as MKNote, MKPart, MKScore, MKConductor, MKPerformer, MKInstrument , MKSynthPatch, MKUnitGenerator, MKOrchestra and MKMidi.
Class descriptions of the MusicKit UnitGenerator Library classes, that implement oscillators, filters, etc.

LISTITEM.PARA: Class descriptions of the MusicKit SynthPatch Library classes, that implement such synthesis techniques as FM synthesis, Wave Table synthesis, Waveshaping synthesis and Karplus/Strong/Jaffe/Smith Plucked String synthesis.

VARLISTENTRY.TERM: DSP Subdirectory―Low level DSP details. This is fairly up to date.

LISTITEM.para: Paper discussing the DSP monitor programs. Only the MusicKit monitor is used here.
Detailed example of writing a new unit generator (DSP module) for the MusicKit.
Further information on writing new unit generators (DSP modules) for the MusicKit.
DSP related documentation that is not MusicKit specific.
